programme.title: Xplore India
programme.desc: As Aradhana’s journey in Chhattisgarh continues, she is stunned to discover the wealth of natural beauty that the state has to offer.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E27 Backpack Novi Sad, Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Boarding Pass Santa Village, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the citys infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous granite city of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finlands largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martins Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 World Spas Kempenki, Jordan (ENG)
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Dubai 1
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 City Breaks Innsbruck, Austria
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 With Love From Mauritius Ep 2
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E26 XP Guide Copenhagen, Denmark
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Unwind Hotel Oriole, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Food Fact Fun Dubai 2
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Food Fact Fun Amsterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Boarding Pass Santa Village, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the citys infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous granite city of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finlands largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martins Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 World Spas Kempenki, Jordan (ENG)
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Dubai 1
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 City Breaks Innsbruck, Austria
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 With Love From Mauritius Ep 2
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E26 XP Guide Copenhagen, Denmark
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Unwind Hotel Oriole, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

The word honey? Yes, because honey plants are plants that attract insects, and in particular bees, which feed on these flowers to make honey.

programme.title: Destination Sardinia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Sardinia
programme.desc: The first stop on this journey to the land of happy, long life is the Ogliastra region of Sardinia. Here, almost one in five inhabitants is over 90 - 20 times more than in France! Yet this is a far cry from the Mediterranean diet recommended by nutritionists: meat and cholesterol galore. Even more astonishing, consanguinity is paradoxically conducive to the extreme longevity of the inhabitants... our wellness food specialist and a general practitioner will investigate these phenomena and meet nonagenarians and centenarians with exceptional stories.

programme.title: Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.desc: To better understand the role of these explosive mountains located all over the world, on land or under the sea, Yann Arthus-Bertrand goes to Italy, the country with the most active volcanoes in Europe. Accompanied by volcano expert Jacques-Marie Bardintzeff, the photographer meets those people who have chosen to live with « their » volcano, in spite of the dangers involved in this kind of proximity.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Origami - Season 1 - The Lotus
programme.desc: Origami is about the art of paper folding, a Japanese and Chinese millenary tradition. In modern usage, the word “origami” is used as an inclusive term for all paper folding, regardless of their cultural origin. Different folding and sculpting techniques, new models, bright colors – you’ll see all of this in our program! We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and astonishing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We find ourselves in Kenya, where the biodiversity is particularly rich, in the Massaï Mara reserve. Then, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the worrying disappearance of hippos from Lake Edward has unexpected consequences for the survival of fishermen. Then, in the sanctuary of life, the Pantanal region in Brazil, where millions of animal and plant species are teeming, some of the worlds great wetlands also in danger. In Tasmania, Yann Arthus-Bertrand fights against the napalm deforestation of one of the oldest and most beautiful forests...

programme.title: The flavors of flowers
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The flavors of flowers
programme.desc: Eating flowers might appear unconventional, but we often consume them without even realizing it. Consider artichokes, for instance : they are essentially large, unopened flowers. Capers are the preserved buds of flowers soaked in vinegar, and cloves are dried flower buds. We also find courgette flowers, saffron pistils, orange blossom water used to flavor pastries, and the violet sweets that evoke memories of our childhood. In addition to adding aesthetic appeal and providing a dose of vitamins to our plates, flowers elevate the flavors of a dish and can even serve as a vegetable substitute.

programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Hot Yoga Session
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Hot Yoga Session
programme.desc: Always on the look for looking for new detox discoveries, Val leads us to Lifehouse’s tonic and elixirs. Here, she discovers the range of elixir with therapeutic virtues exhilarating and relaxing. Before leaving, we made a hook by Jacks lab to prepare our own elixir. A private hot Yoga session then awaited Val at the popular Urban Exhale Hot Yoga where wearing a swimsuit could be welcomed. This episode ends on a fruity note as we tasted smoothies with unusual names that seduced Val, especially the 72 and Sun.

programme.title: Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.desc: Val gives an appointment to the singer Sinclair, for a floating session: a sensory deprivation technique in a bath. Then, we will discover an experience that is all the rage across the Atlantic, the Barre Shape! Its a class that mixes classical dance, yoga and cardio training. All this in a girly and boudoir atmosphere. After the effort comes comfort! We will meet a Superfood expert who will make us test and discover all the "Superfoods" that are very popular in California and that the whole healthy world is talking about.

programme.title: Collecting seeds
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Collecting seeds
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to save seeds. As you may have noticed, fruits, such as apples and lemons, contain seeds, but so do some of the vegetables you eat, such as peppers and tomatoes. This is because they are, in fact, fruits just like the apple and the lemon. They come from a flower and therefore contain seeds.

programme.title: Destination Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Okinawa
programme.desc: Genetic, biological, cultural and dietary factors combine to make the Japanese island of Okinawa a zone of extreme longevity. Why is it that cancer is virtually non-existent here? Well see that the famous Japanese trio of "rice, fish and soy" is not the key to longevity, but a diet based on plants, lots of green leafy vegetables and endemic sweet potatoes. Self-restriction and strong social ties are other elements that our naturopathic chef and attending physician will discover on site, together with local inhabitants and scientists.

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized mans life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didnt manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. Its today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrels price, well...

programme.title: Greece, Euphoria Retreat
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Greece, Euphoria Retreat
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset, embark on a transformative journey to Euphoria Retreat.A mystical place offering a holistic approach to well-being aimed at restoring balance between body, mind and soul.After a long struggle with illness, its founder embarked on a personal quest to find balance. An in-depth reflection which resulted in the creation of a place where one could share and transmit this method of well-being. Euphoria Retreat is a clever blend of Taoist and Hellenic philosophy based on the symbolism of the five elements: water, wood, fire, earth and metal. Ancestral wisdom and scientific advances offer a transformative immersion in self-discovery. The tools developed by Euphoria...

programme.title: Italy, Palazzo Fiuggi
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Italy, Palazzo Fiuggi
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset we discover Palazzo Fiuggi, a haven of well-being located in the heart of the natural springs of Fiuggi, famous for their purifying and healing powers.The Palazzo was born from the vision of a science and health enthusiast. This historic place of well-being offers exclusive medical-scientific therapies combining the healing properties of water with advances in Western medicine and alternative medicines. Upon arrival, a team of specialists carries out a targeted diagnosis to create a personalized protocol, rebalancing the mind, body and soul, with a simple promise: offering a longer and better-lived life.A constantly evolving method, between ancestral wisdom and...

programme.title: Poultry on the menu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Poultry on the menu
programme.desc: Julie heads for Burgundy to discover ancient breeds of poultry reintroduced to France thanks to the work of breeder Fred Menager. Well then move on to Auvergne to discover how the famous Label Rouge is awarded and the role of certifying bodies ... because its important to know what ends up on our plates. Julie also travels to the Drôme to cook guinea fowl, before heading to the Perigord to prepare a turkey stew. Julie will then head back up towards the center to discover an amazing fly maker who uses rooster feathers!

programme.title: Floating Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Floating Yoga
programme.desc: Just Float, this is the latest yoga trend and mantra for an relaxed mind. As you enter a fully soundproof studio and float in vats filled with epson salts, you will disconnect from the urban buzz. That is Val’s promise as she takes us to experience this funny trend. With a sain mind comes a sain body: it’s time to head to Clover Juice, the most famous juice address in Los Angeles. As we make our way through Clover’s kitchen, we discover this way of life, mix and learn more on these beverage’s benefits.

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Animal Farm
programme.desc: In this episode, we will go to a ranch, which is a real sanctuary for animals. The animals are king and the llama is the star. This center takes in animals to give them a safer and happier life in a beautiful setting. Then Val will participate in a Namastday Yoga session, another trend in yoga involving ropes hanging from the ceiling, acrobatic poses and great flexibility.

programme.title: Planting vegetables in the fall
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Planting vegetables in the fall
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville, to continue installing vegetables in the vegetable garden. Yes, it is possible, even in autumn. Because if its true that most vegetables are planted in spring or summer, some varieties can be planted in early autumn and are fast-growing, which will allow you to harvest them in late autumn or early winter. Lets get started! Were going to plant winter spinach together and well show you a little trick you need to know to harvest it properly.

For this youll need quinoa, carrot, avocado, cucumber, radish, chioggia beet, pomegranate and buckwheat seeds, and mint. This bowl is composed by different colored vegetables which allows us to fill up with nutrients, minerals and vitamins. The look of a nice dish makes us secrete more digestive enzymes.

programme.title: Claire
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 3 - Claire
programme.desc: One woman’s personal mission to reduce her household rubbish turned into a passion that gave birth to Southeast Asia’s first Zero-Waste Bulk Food shop. Claire is a driven and successful mother of three who turned away from her corporate job to channel her business-savvy into reducing our impact on the environment and contributing to the improvement of her local community.

programme.title: Zaira (Argentina)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Zaira (Argentina)
programme.desc: For a long time Zaira let herself be defined solely as a survivor of the traumatic sexual assault that marked her life. In her healing search, she left behind the busy city life and moved to seek solace in the mountains of Mendoza. It is among these magnificent peaks that Zaira found peace within herself and harmony with her surroundings. Now, eager to help others heal, she is the leader of a trekking initiative that doubles as a support group for other women who are victims of sexual aggression.

programme.title: Ile (Argentina)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Ile (Argentina)
programme.desc: Ileana studied business and worked long hours indoors for a multinational logistics company. Her love for dance and desire for movement drove her to quit her corporate life and begin a new chapter as a fitness trainer. Quickly exhausting the traditional methods available at her local gyms, she began to create innovative and groundbreaking exercise methods of her own. Her goal: to empower women by making them feel strong and feminine at the same time.

programme.title: So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.desc: Water and its beauty, water and its power, water and its fragility... the water we all need is becoming scarce, through our own fault. Some rivers are dry, others are diverted, cut off by dams, others are simply polluted, and this for decades. We will discover how humans transformed the nature in Argentina, then in China and its disproportionate Three Gorges Dam. We will also go in Botswana with the Okavango, this unique river which flows into a desert forming the famous Okavango Delta. Vu du Ciel makes you discover once again another world, magnificent but threatened.

programme.title: Differential relaxation
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 5 - Differential relaxation
programme.desc: This exercise helps you develop what we call differential relaxation. The aim is to learn to relax the entire body except the parts necessary to the proper development of an action. For example, when youre working in the office, your back and your arms are often extremely contracted when really only your eyes and hands are involved in the task.

programme.title: France, Le Bruit de leau
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - France, Le Bruit de leau
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset, we take you to “Le Bruit de leau”, an ecolodge nestled in the heart of the Baie de Somme nature reserve, in France. In the middle of nature, discover a place of absolute serenity inspired by the Japanese lifestyle and the travels of a great reporter, its founder.The intimate atmosphere that reigns at Le Bruit de leau (The Sound of Water) envelops you in a soothing calm, creating a cocoon made for relaxation and personal rejuvenation.This ecolodge allows us to cultivate awareness of the present moment and to open up to a fulfilling perception of our environment. Le Bruit de leau opens the doors to a transformative experience, where beauty of the natural...

programme.title: Sri Lanka, Santani
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Sri Lanka, Santani
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset, we fly to Sri Lanka to discover an old tea plantation transformed into a sumptuous refuge: Santani.In order to find an alternative to the stress of urban life, the hotel offers a modern approach to Ayurveda. This traditional Indian medicine aims to establish a balance between the individual and the world around them. Thanks to the development of a personalized program, each visitor is invited to find harmony within this restorative sanctuary.Santani was created by a Sri Lankan eager to preserve our physical and spiritual well-being in a peaceful and healthy place to reconnect with the world differently. Lets discover a holistic approach to health, including...

programme.title: The flavors of chocolate
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The flavors of chocolate
programme.desc: Today, the gluttons should not be disappointed since chocolate is in the spotlight. Discovered by the Mayans 2500 years ago and then more widely by the Aztecs, chocolate is today one of the favorite products in the world. And make no mistake about it: just as the kitchen has its great chefs, chocolate also has its great chocolatiers.As for recipes, Julie will introduce you to a cake that is only made in Saint Émilien and which combines chocolate with macarons, before heading to the Basque Country for a dessert to spice you up. We will then climb up the mountain to meet a Swiss cook. Finally, you will see that chocolate has several surprises in store for us: it has many virtues and is...

programme.title: Hotel on Pacific
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Hotel on Pacific
programme.desc: Val takes us to one of the most beautiful hotels in California: The Belmont Hotel! Much more than a hotel, this place is a natural haven where everything is made to relax while overlooking the Pacific. While relaxation is key, we also seek adventures, don’t we? While in this dream setting, we will practice yoga among the turtles, walk around the vertical and organic garden with the Chef and treat ourselves with a massage with essential oils coming directly from the garden.

programme.title: Surfing and Vineyards
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Surfing and Vineyards
programme.desc: Yoga and Surf are two corner stones of the Californian spirit. In this episode, the best of both worlds meets as Val shares a surf session with a local champion from Malibu! What about the surfing outfit ? No need for it, there is a yoga mat. Let’s head to Ojai, in the middle of a vineyards, and joint the "Topa Wines" group for a yoga session at the sunset. Together, we will enjoy the "Pink moment": the time when Ojai’s mountains turn pink and your mind is blown away.

programme.title: Repotting an indoor plant
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Repotting an indoor plant
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to take good care of our indoor plants. The plants that grow in our houses and flats are grown in pots. And when we buy a new plant, it is very important to repot it. The plants we buy come in pots that are often too small for them to grow well. Thats why you put it in a bigger pot.

programme.title: Agostina (Argentina)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Agostina (Argentina)
programme.desc: When Agostina’s mother was diagnosed with breast cancer, she began seeking out soft natural fabrics that would not irritate her mother’s sensitive skin. She found it almost impossible to find the right materials, so she decided to make her own. Research led her to bamboo fibers and she realised she could make a positive impact on the environment, while developing sustainable and ethical fashion.

programme.title: Solenn (Nantes)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Solenn (Nantes)
programme.desc: A former school teacher reinvents herself when she discovers a passion for sharing other women’s stories. Always inspired by the journeys of strong women, Solenn began a blog to celebrate the women in her community. Solenn’s energy and passion fueled a dream of starting her own magazine. Thanks to a successful crowdfunding campaign, this dream blossomed into a professional career in journalism and she launched a print mook (magazine and book) called Etonnantes. Etonnantes features interviews of women of all backgrounds, celebrating their diversity and success in each field.

programme.title: Sophie (Nantes)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Sophie (Nantes)
programme.desc: Always an artist at heart, Sophie grew up in the countryside amongst nature and farm animals. Her love for creating art while respecting nature turned into a drive to seek out sustainable vegetable dyes.Today, her artwork and craft are intertwined as she makes beautiful prints and motifs that she colours with natural dyes, prepared from handpicked variety of flowers and plants that turn into stunning creations.

programme.title: So the great rivers may live - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - So the great rivers may live - Part 2
programme.desc: Yann Arthus-Bertrand thus continues his world tour and his inventory of the planet with the great rivers that suffer from mans excesses as a common thread. " So the great rivers may live" is the discovery of places, men and women who are fighting so that our waterways simply have their place on Earth. Thanks to his genius, man is correcting his mistakes: the Aral Sea, which once disappeared, is coming back. In New York, millions of people have drinking water thanks to the natural virtues of the forest.

programme.title: Of Forests and Men - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - Of Forests and Men - Part 2
programme.desc: The call of the Forest is about discovering places but above all it is about meeting those who protect this priceless heritage. Forests are essential to mankind. They capture CO2, promote the formation of clouds and therefore rain, protect the soil from erosion and provide a habitat for wildlife. From Madagascar, to France, to Cameroon, or even Eritrea, Yann Arthus-Bertrand sets out to discover the most beautiful forests, those who live in them, those who protect them and those who live off them.

programme.title: The cheese menu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The cheese menu
programme.desc: Today, Julie sets on the roads of France to talk about an essential product on French tables: cheese. More than a gourmet craze, more than an end-of-meal treat, cheese is associated with French gastronomy, and is also recognized as Intangible Cultural Heritage by UNESCO. With nearly 1,000 varieties (soft cheeses, cooked, blue-veined, pressed cheeses…), the French are the biggest consumers of cheese in the world!

programme.title: Martial Arts and meditation
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Martial Arts and meditation
programme.desc: Today, we will meet in Santa Monica in the hub of the last healthy trends. Val will make us discover Erewhon, the biggest organic and hipster supermarket in Los Angeles. She will then meet Troy, a guru of healthy consciousness, for an outdoor class that mixes martial arts and meditation. Then, on the legendary "Muscle Beach", the beach of all athletes, we will meet David, an action movie double, for a very aerial workout.

programme.title: Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.desc: Val takes us to discover Palm Springs, the trendy and designer city in the heart of the California desert. In the heart of a private collection, we will discover all the flora of this region: an outdoor plant museum, one of the largest collections of cacti, and even tequila flowers. Then well head to the Paseo Hotel, one of the zen and design hotels of Palm Springs, where well meet the chef of the restaurant who will concoct his signature dishes. We will end our day with a relaxing massage with crystals.

programme.title: Carving a Halloween pumpkin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Carving a Halloween pumpkin
programme.desc: We meet again in the market garden of Romainville, for a special Halloween episode. In one of our first episodes, we learned how to sow a pumpkin seed. The pumpkins, which I had installed in my vegetable garden, have grown well now that we are in autumn. And thats good because today were going to show you how to dig a pumpkin to make a beautiful Halloween lantern.

An ideal dish for a light starter or a warming dinner.

programme.title: Paul John Elliott
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Paul John Elliott
programme.desc: Without really knowing why, Paul Elliott will change his life from cartoonist to massage therapist. Aspired by success, money, success, he will create several clinics and will eventually lose the human aspects and lose himself. A new turn, a new meeting and Paul will finally resume his dreams of painting. Follow Paul in his tumults and his happiness found.

programme.title: Annabelle Higgins and Valérie Sirois
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Annabelle Higgins and Valérie Sirois
programme.desc: They are beautiful sisters, they are passionate about nature and they have a very strong common point: entrepreneurship. After years of evolution in consumer sectors, discover Annabelle and Valerie who knew how to listen to their passion to create a fitness and surf club (for Annabelle) and a zero waste grocery store (for Valerie).

programme.title: Véronick Desmarais
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Véronick Desmarais
programme.desc: The everyday work is not always easy and it is sometimes difficult to get by. If there is one thing that Veronick has learned from her experience and those around her, it is because she is able to surpass that and to embark on her dreams and plans to become a massage therapist. You will believe in your abilities too.

programme.title: Violaine Courtois
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Violaine Courtois
programme.desc: Everything started from the dream of her parents, she becomes a veterinarian. In her career that she launched backwards, Violaine will meet people who will take her to a different path of life. The chance will be at the rendezvous but it is especially the courage to resume studies and create his company that will build his project. Follow the encounters and travels of Violaine that brought her to fasciatherapy and nonviolent communication.

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 2
programme.desc: The incredible diversity of flora and fauna, the fight against climate change, the balance between growth and sustainable development: these are all battles being fought on five continents. Yann Arthus-Bertrand takes us on this expedition. Were off to Gabon to discover the Ivindo National Park and Port-Gentil, then on to Sri Lanka in Kandi. Back to Gabon we go to Libreville, then Lambarene to talk about turtles and the health of the local people. Finally, off to Dhaka-Bangladesh.

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 1
programme.desc: How can we reconcile the development needed to sustain the lives of nearly seven billion people with the protection of the Earths natural resources? Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team have chosen Gabon to continue their survey of the planet. Well be discovering the Kongou Falls, the Langoue clearing with their elephant in Gabon. Then in Colombia, we will go on the island of Malpelo with their shark. Back to Gabon we will discover the Minkebe National Park and the bats in Franceville. We will also go to India in Hyderabad, which has convinced farmers to use no pesticides and no GMOs in their cultivation.

programme.title: Citrus flavors
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Citrus flavors
programme.desc: Julie takes you through the Pyrenees Orientales, then Corsica, before making a stop on the Côte dAzur, and concludes her journey between Rungis and Paris... all to explore the world of citrus fruits! These fruits add flavor, zest, and seasoning to any recipe, making them indispensable in the kitchen. They bring the warmth and sunshine of the South of France and the exoticism of distant lands. While were all familiar with lemons, clementines, and grapefruits, Julie introduces us to a thousand other varieties.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Topanga Canyon, AMBA Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Topanga Canyon, AMBA Yoga
programme.desc: Val goes to the heart of Topanga Canyon, California, a favorite spot for yoga addicts and nature lovers. Here she will experience AMBA Yoga, a kind of hollistic yoga for women. We will also attend a Sound Bowl session, a Tibetan practice considered the ultimate in meditation. In the heart of Venice Beach, we will discover the "Plant Lab", a new high-tech application that records the vibrations of plants to create music. Finally, Val will present us the largest concept store of rare crystals in South America.

programme.title: Hot Springs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Hot Springs
programme.desc: Still in Palm Springs, we will discover the Parker Hotel, the most trendy and design hotel in town. A French chef will take us to cook in the middle of nature. Then, Val will go to Desert Springs, a town known for its natural hot springs. At one of the many spas in town, Val will test one of the springs and even attend a Sound Bowl session.

programme.title: Growing mushrooms at home
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Growing mushrooms at home
programme.desc: We meet at the Romainville market garden centre to learn how to grow mushrooms at home. Some varieties, such as button mushrooms, oyster mushrooms or shiitake mushrooms, grow quite easily in mushroom houses. But you too can do it. And today we will show you how to make a miniature version of this kit to grow oyster mushrooms at home.

programme.title: Mashed potatoes with vegetable gravy
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Mashed potatoes with vegetable gravy
programme.desc: In this recipe, we prepare mashed potatoes in vegetable stock. The mashed potatoes are soft and melt-in-the-mouth, while the richly flavored broth of bell bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, celeriac and tomato enhances the whole.

programme.title: Sweet potato bruschetta
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Sweet potato bruschetta
programme.desc: In this recipe, we reinvent the classic bruschetta by replacing the bread with a roasted sweet potato base. Garnished with tomatoes, guacamole, chilli pepper and a drizzle of olive oil, this healthy and tasty bruschetta is perfect for an aperitif or a light starter.

programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Carine (Nice)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Carine (Nice)
programme.desc: After twenty years as a lawyer, Carine decided to give in to her desire to help others heal. Her inner journey led her to discover a passion for naturopathy as she rediscovered her love for nature and learned the healing qualities of the plants around her. Combined with a deep understanding of astrology and nutrition, she is now able to help others live better and find their own path.

programme.title: Virginie (Lyon)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Virginie (Lyon)
programme.desc: Virginie’s beautiful handwritten lettering decorates the walls and windows of many shops in and around Lyon, France, as she lives out her passion of finding beauty in every stroke. A former waitress, Virginie was struggling to find her calling when she suffered a life-altering horse accident that almost left her handicapped. At only 30, she was forced to put her whole life into perspective. She finally found herself through a love for graphic design and lettering, combined with a desire for freedom that came with working independently. To motivate other women, she has also launched “Ladyboss”, a network of inspiring women entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Laetitia (French Alps)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Laetitia (French Alps)
programme.desc: While pregnant with her daughter, Laetitia, a former journalist, experienced a strong desire to change lifestyles and move to the countryside. Remembering the teachings of her grandmother, she began to venture outdoors into the surrounding Alps and study the different plants at her fingertips. Today she holds a wealth of knowledge about the medicinal and aromatherapeutic value of plants that she applies to making natural products. With utmost respect for the environment, Laetitia gathers only what she needs in order to make herbal infusions.

programme.title: Louise (Oleron Island)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Louise (Oleron Island)
programme.desc: At only 20 years old, Louise is full of confidence and already achieved a personal dream of hers to share her passion for nutritious and locally-sourced ingredients on the island of Oleron, France. Repurposing a camping car, she set up a brunch and tea-time spot where the guests can hand-pick their ingredients in the adjacent organic fields. Louise transforms the ingredients into favourite creations of hers and even joins her father for boat trips when she needs to stock up on fresh fish for the menu!

programme.title: Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 1
programme.desc: In this instalment, Yann Arthus-Bertrand lifts the veil on the products people buy. Almost everything we buy has a direct impact on our environment. We head to Japan to talk about the impact of new technologies, then to the Republic of Congo in Bukavu for the coltan harvest. How does our total consumption affect the environment? What permanent brands are we imposing on our planet? How can we differentiate between useful and useless purchases?

programme.desc: Massage studio will show you the best massage techniques in places which will make you dream. Let us take care of you! Lay down, relax and forget all your problems.

programme.title: Mental concentration and relaxation
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 5 - Mental concentration and relaxation
programme.desc: This exercise will first help you become aware of your ability to concentrate and then help you improve it in order to beat the sense of fatigue. What tires the mind most is wandering thoughts, while logical tasks which challenge your concentration and attention can fill you with newfound energy.

programme.title: Staying zen on the subway
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 10 - Staying zen on the subway
programme.desc: This exercise can accompany you on the train or subway to help you make your travel time a time to relax and recharge your batteries.

programme.title: Get rid of the stress and tension that may come with take-off
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 2 - Get rid of the stress and tension that may come with take-off
programme.desc: During this session, thanks to simple movements, and by working on your breathing, you will get rid of the tensions related to the departure and the takeoff of a flight. You will feel relaxed for a pleasant flight...

programme.title: Dealing with sibling rivalry
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 12 - Dealing with sibling rivalry
programme.desc: This session will help you calm down when your children start to fight and teach you to play the situation down.

programme.title: Getting your kids to tidy up their rooms
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Audio advices - Season 12 - Getting your kids to tidy up their rooms
programme.desc: This exercise will help you encourage your kids to tidy up their room without it becoming a source of conflict.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 2
programme.desc: Above all, these reports are an opportunity for Yann Arthus-Bertrand to take stock of the planet and denounce certain human behaviors that are at the root of dramatic, even irreversible, environmental and climatic degradation. Off to Tokyo, then Kenya, to an animal sanctuary. Then on to Mount Fuji to learn how to live there, and all the plastic that clogs up the seas. Reports will focus on everyday products, chosen for their destructive production practices for both people and the environment.

programme.title: The taste of bread
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The taste of bread
programme.desc: Today, Julie takes you on a bread trail to uncover the dedicated artisan bakers and millers. Her adventure will lead her through the Libourne region, then onwards to the North of France, the Ardèche, and the Aisne, where bakers have transformed bread into a powerful catalyst for social cohesion. While some individuals may avoid bread, particularly due to gluten-related concerns, others have chosen to reposition it at the forefront of the dining experience by championing its nutritional benefits. This commitment is shared by several chefs whom Julie will meet at the conclusion of her expedition.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Ojai Valley Lavender Festival
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Ojai Valley Lavender Festival
programme.desc: Val Kahl is in the heart of Ojai, the lavender town, where she takes a tour in Ojai Valley Lavender Festival and tastes drink, gluten-free cookies and organic cooking products made of lavender. She later found herself in the middle of lavender field while stopping by the Frog Creek Farm. After working out on the hot power yoga around palm trees in Caravan Outpost, she heads out to Gratitude Rock for an organic fresh juice tasting with an avocado ranch view.

programme.title: Japanese pagodas and Coconut Massage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Japanese pagodas and Coconut Massage
programme.desc: Val goes to Nicholas, a master of enlightenment, at his wellness ranch. Here, Val will try out some new high-tech relaxation sessions. She will then go to one of the zenest hotels in California, where she will participate in a yoga session in a Japanese pagoda, followed by a coconut massage. She will test a Cryo-Cafe, a new concept store that mixes coffee break and cryotherapy session. Finally, she will attend a Theremin session, a very special relaxation ceremony.

programme.title: Thinning seedlings
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Thinning seedlings
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to continue gardening together. In our previous episodes, we sowed chives and radishes. Today, were going to learn how to take good care of them. And as a bonus, well show you a great technique to easily get even more plants in your garden. Lets get started!

programme.title: Risotto with asparagus
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Risotto with asparagus
programme.desc: In this recipe, we prepare a creamy asparagus risotto, a delicate and refined dish. Arborio rice is slowly simmered in a flavorful broth, then combined with crisp asparagus and melted Parmesan. A hint of lemon and fresh herbs enhances this delicious and comforting meal.

programme.title: Potato cutlets with vegetable puree
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Potato cutlets with vegetable puree
programme.desc: In this recipe, well prepare delicious potato cutlets accompanied by a creamy vegetable puree. The cutlets are crispy on the outside with Japanese breadcrumbs and tender on the inside, while the celeriac puree adds a touch of sweetness and lightness. This dish is perfect for a comforting and tasty vegetarian meal.

programme.title: Juliette (Morbihan)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Juliette (Morbihan)
programme.desc: Juliette has long been aware of the delicate beauty of nature. For years she spent her life on the sea, organising regattas for the traditional sailboats that are famous in the French region of Morbihan. Her appreciation for the elements made for a smooth transition as she decided to leave the water behind and return to the earth. Learning to shape a ball of clay into a graceful and elegant object, she discovered a passion for ceramics. Today, she lives from her creations and makes pieces that reflect their surroundings, the stunning Gulf of Morbihan.

programme.title: Anna (Brittany)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Anna (Brittany)
programme.desc: Anna’s unusual background provided inspiration for her life change. Her career began as a wolf trainer for cinema and it was during these years that she developed her deep love for animals. After being tired of seeing them used as props and constantly in cages, she decided to leave the world of show business behind and start an eco-friendly sheep and goat pasture. To further share her passion for these gentle animals, Anna has opened a conservatory farm where visitors can experience first-hand the joys of being close to nature. She also makes amazing goat cheese!

programme.title: Cristina (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Cristina (Spain)
programme.desc: At 31 years old, the last thing Cristina expected when she went to see the doctor about a blocked ear was to leave the consultation with a diagnosis for Breast Cancer. This young and passionate sociologist decided to apply the same philosophy to her treatment as she did when surfing: when a wave crashes down on you, get up and try again. Through her healing journey she deepened her love for the ocean and also discovered the therapeutic capabilities of yoga for cancer patients. Today she shares her practice through surf and yoga retreats and is specialised in oncological yoga, helping others heal.

programme.title: Idoia (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Idoia (Spain)
programme.desc: Idoia thrives on weaving together the sources of inspiration that surround her. Heavily influenced by the natural beauty of her home region of Galicia, Spain, she creates unique woven pieces from diverse and beautiful materials. Idoia’s pieces represent her vision of a modern woman, drawing from the traditions and experiences of those who perfected the craft before her and also pushing to innovate and adapt her creations for the modern world. Her recent collaboration with luxury fashion house Loewe is a dream come true for this modern artisan.

programme.desc: The Marathon International des Gorges de lArdèche is an annual canoe and kayak race in France. Participants navigate a 27-kilometre course through the breathtaking Ardèche Gorge.

programme.desc: The GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2024 is coming to Dakhla, bringing the best wingfoilers in the world to this Moroccan paradise. With its reliable winds and breathtaking landscapes, Dakhla offers the perfect backdrop for exciting races.

programme.title: Profile Freeskier Nadine Wallner
programme.desc: Nadine Wallner is a freeskier, climber and mountaineer who has experienced incredible highs and devastating lows on her journey of discovery. She takes part in the Freeride World Tour, the pinnacle of freeriding competition for skiers and snowboarders.

programme.title: Swatch Timeline - This Is My Winter
programme.desc: Experience the mountain with the myth-Xavier De Le Rue. There are so many moments so many adventures so many ways of seeing the mountains. You only need a few magic days to film a part for a snowboard film. But this season it took me six months - so: This is my winter.

programme.title: Mammut Project 360 Grad
programme.desc: "Project360" takes digital mapping into the third dimension and makes the legendary Eiger North Face a virtual experience. A view through the eyes of the climber, directly from the wall. The impressive 360° panorama of the walls: www.project360.mammut.ch

programme.title: Roopkund - Mountainbike Expedition to the Indian Himalaya
programme.desc: Hans Rey, Richie Schley and Joscha Forstreuter travelled to the Indian Himalayas to the mysterious Roopkund Lake, which is known for having hundreds of ancient human skeletons lying dormant at its bottom. This is followed by a descent of 3,500 metres in altitude.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2022 - stop #1 - Baqueira Beret (ESP)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Freeride World Tour 2022 "Live Summary"
programme.desc: The 2022 Freeride World Tour kicks off in January in ist 15th season in January - as usual with the best freeriders all over the globe! Right at the beginning a brand-new stop in Baqueira Beret (ESP) awaits the athletes.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #38: World Downhill Skateboarding Championship - Isle of Men (IMN)
programme.desc: The Downhill Skateboarding World Championships on the Isle of Man bring the worlds fastest riders to one of the most challenging courses. In the “Stand Up Men” category, you can expect pure speed, fiercely contested races, and breathtaking descents.

programme.title: Cape Epic 2022 - Stage 5
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the worlds premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year and takes ambitious amateur and professional mountain bikers from all over the world over 650 untamed kilometres through pristine landscapes.

programme.title: Searching for the Rivergod II

programme.title: adidas Sickline - Extreme Kayak World Championship - The Documentary
programme.desc: This is the documentary about the history of the famous "Wellerbrucke" rapids, a famous section of the glacier-fed Ötztaler Ache river in Tyrol, and the adidas Sickline Extreme Kayak World Championship.

programme.title: Outdoorsports Team - The Fascination of ski Mountaineering
programme.desc: The film “Fascination of Ski Mountaineering” shows four top Austrian athletes doing high-alpine ski mountaineering from the Mittelbergjoch over the Taschach Glacier to the Wildspitze.

programme.title: Canyoning 2008
programme.desc: Canyoning is one of the most exciting outdoor sports and for many it is a true decathlon of extreme activities. Physical fitness, team spirit and trust are of the utmost importance.

programme.title: World Downhill Skateboarding Championship 2025 - Axamer Lizum (AUT) - Live delayed
programme.desc: Be part of the World Downhill Skateboarding Championship 2025 in Axamer Lizum, Austria! At this exciting high-speed event, the best downhill skateboarders from all over the world will race down the picturesque Alpine roads at breathtaking speeds.

programme.title: WOF 2023 #28: ITF Beach Tennis World Tour 2023 - Brasilia Classic 2023 (BRA)
programme.desc: Nach einem spannenden Mai, in dem die Sand Series Gran Canaria Classic und die Beach Tennis World Championships in zwei aufeinanderfolgenden Wochen stattfanden, reisen die Spielerinnen nach Brasilien zur dritten Ausgabe der Sand Series Brasilia Classic.

programme.title: WOF 2023 #29: European Freestyle Pro Tour - Vieste (ITA)
programme.desc: In der heutigen Folge besuchen wir die European Freestyle Pro Tour 2023 im italienischen Vieste. Die Windsurfer werden ihr Konnen auf dem Wasser zeigen und uns ein wenig Wassersport-Action auf dem Mittelmeer bieten.

programme.title: WOF 2023 #30: WES E-Bike World Series #1 and #2
programme.desc: In der heutigen Folge werfen wir einen Blick auf die erste und zweite Runde der World E-Bike Series 2023 in Monaco und Bologna, Italien. Aber wer kann die Rennen der Manner und Frauen gewinnen? Lasst es uns herausfinden!

programme.title: WOF 2023 #31: European Freestyle Pro Tour 2023 - Mid Season Recap
programme.desc: Die ersten Events der European Freestyle Pro Tour 2023 sind vorbei und wir werfen einen Blick zuruck auf die besten Windsurfer der Welt und ihre epischen Tricks auf dem Wasser.

programme.title: Profile Marcel Remy - On top of Miroir de l´Argentine
programme.desc: It is his favorite route: the 450 meter north-west face of the famous Miroir de l’Argentine. For more than the 200th time, Marcel Remy, father of Yves and Claude Remy, climbs this classic peak with his sons on August 22, 2017. At the age of 94.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2022 - stop #2 - Ordino Arcalís (AND)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Freeride World Tour 2022 "Live Summary"
programme.desc: Following the inaugural event at Baqueira Beret (ESP) last weekend, the Freeride World Tour returns to the perennial Pyrenean freeride mecca of Ordino Arcalís, Andorra!

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 – Sal (CPV) – Overall Highlights
programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour is looking forward to returning to the Cape Verdean island of Sal to open the 2024 season with the discipline of kite surfing. In February, the best kite-surfing athletes will compete against each other at the Kite-Surf World Cup

programme.title: Dream Job
programme.desc: A comedy documentary about a girl working in the ski industry who decides to become one of the stars: they go up, they go down, how difficult can it be? Needless to say, she finds out how hard it really can be.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #26: Freestyle Pro Tour
programme.desc: Today we are visiting the Windsurfers paradise which is why the Freestyle Pro Tour is visiting it every year for its biggest event of the season. This will be the first ever FPT event that runs all three Freestyle windsurfing disciplines at the same time.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #27: World E-Bike Series Round #1 and #2
programme.desc: Welcome from WES Round 1 and 2 in Trentino, Alto Garda, for the UCI E-MTB XC World Cup Season Opener. First time ever in the astonishing Dolomites mountain area in northern Italy, well-known for its tradition in e-biking, MTB and cyclo-tourism.

programme.title: The history of competitive Snowboarding

programme.title: Swatch Freeride World Tour 2015 - 20th Anniversary Xtreme Verbier - Part 1

programme.title: Red Bull Romaniacs 2025 - 150min Live Summary
programme.desc: RB Romaniacs challenges hundreds of dedicated amateur participants to compete alongside the worlds best professionals. They gather in Sibiu, Romania. Participants come from over 60 countries and continents around the world.

programme.title: WOF 2023 #32: Ötztaler Radmarathon 2023

programme.title: WOF 2023 #33: Mystic Skate Cup 2023

programme.title: WOF 2023 #34: Red Bull Romaniacs 2023 - Sibiu (ROU)

programme.title: WOF 2023 #35: GKA Kitesurfing World Tour 2023 - The Stars of Big Air

programme.title: 5 Peaks in One Day - Mountaineering
programme.desc: Zermatt, Switzerland - Swiss alpinist Andreas Steindl (26) has accomplished what most people deem impossible: he ran 30.66 kilometres from Zermatt to Saas Fee crossing five 4000m peaks. in only 7 hours, 45 minutes and 44 seconds.

programme.title: Worlds Wildest Police Videos
